harper.path.description: Optional path to a harper-ls executable to use.

harper.codeActions.ForceStable.description: Make code actions appear in "stable" positions by placing code actions that should always be available like adding misspelled words in the dictionary first.

harper.diagnosticSeverity.description: How severe do you want diagnostics to appear in the editor?

harper.fileDictPath.description: Optional path to a file dictionary directory to use.

harper.isolateEnglish.description: Only lint English text in documents that are a mixture of English and another language.

harper.userDictPath.description: Optional path to a global dictionary file to use.

harper.linters.AmazonNames.description: When referring to the various products of Amazon.com, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.Americas.description: When referring to North, Central, and South America, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.AnA.description: A rule that looks for incorrect indefinite articles. For example, `this is an mule` would be flagged as incorrect.

harper.linters.AndIn.description: Fixes the incorrect phrase `an in` to `and in` for proper conjunction usage.

harper.linters.AndTheLike.description: Fixes the typo in `and the like`.

harper.linters.Anybody.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `anybody`.

harper.linters.Anyhow.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `anyhow`.

harper.linters.Anywhere.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `anywhere`.

harper.linters.AppleNames.description: When referring to Apple products and services, make sure to treat them as proper nouns.

harper.linters.Australia.description: When referring to the states of Australia, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.AvoidAndAlso.description: Reduces redundancy by replacing `and also` with `and`.

harper.linters.AvoidCurses.description: A rule that looks for common offensive language.

harper.linters.AzureNames.description: When referring to Azure cloud services, make sure to treat them as proper nouns.

harper.linters.BackInTheDay.description: This linter flags instances of the nonstandard phrase `back in the days`. The correct, more accepted form is `back in the day`

harper.linters.Backplane.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `backplane`.

harper.linters.BadRap.description: Changes `bed rap` to the proper idiom `bad rap`.

harper.linters.BaitedBreath.description: Ensures `bated breath` is written correctly, as `baited breath` is incorrect.

harper.linters.BanTogether.description: Detects and corrects the common error of using `ban together` instead of the idiom `band together`, which means to unite or join forces.

harper.linters.BareInMind.description: Ensures the phrase `bear in mind` is used correctly instead of `bare in mind`.

harper.linters.BatedBreath.description: Changes `baited breath` to the correct `bated breath`.

harper.linters.BeckAndCall.description: Fixes `back and call` to `beck and call`.

harper.linters.BeenThere.description: Corrects the misspelling `bee there` to the proper phrase `been there`.

harper.linters.BoringWords.description: This rule looks for particularly boring or overused words. Using varied language is an easy way to keep a reader's attention.

harper.linters.ByAccident.description: Incorrect preposition: `by accident` is the idiomatic expression.

harper.linters.CanBeSeen.description: Corrects `can be seem` to the proper phrase `can be seen`.

harper.linters.Canada.description: When referring to the provinces of Canada, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.CapitalizePersonalPronoun.description: Forgetting to capitalize personal pronouns, like "I" or "I'm" is one of the most common errors. This rule helps with that.

harper.linters.ChangeTack.description: Locates minor errors in the sailing idiom `change tack`.

harper.linters.ChineseCommunistParty.description: When referring to the political party, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.ChockFull.description: Flags common soundalikes of "chock-full" and makes sure they're hyphenated.

harper.linters.CompoundNouns.description: Detects compound nouns split by a space and suggests merging them when both parts form a valid noun.

harper.linters.CondenseAllThe.description: Suggests removing `of` in `all of the` for a more concise phrase.

harper.linters.CorrectNumberSuffix.description: When making quick edits, it is common for authors to change the value of a number without changing its suffix. This rule looks for these cases, for example: `2st`.

harper.linters.Countries.description: When referring to Countries, make sure to treat it as a proper noun.

harper.linters.CurrencyPlacement.description: The location of currency symbols varies by country. The rule looks for and corrects improper positioning.

harper.linters.DayOneNames.description: Ensure proper capitalization of Day One and Day One Premium as brand names.

harper.linters.Desktop.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `desktop`.

harper.linters.DespiteOf.description: Corrects the misuse of `despite of` and suggests the proper alternatives `despite` or `in spite of`.

harper.linters.Devops.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `devops`.

harper.linters.DotInitialisms.description: Ensures common initialisms (like "i.e.") are properly dot-separated.

harper.linters.EllipsisLength.description: Make sure you have the correct number of dots in your ellipsis.

harper.linters.EludedTo.description: Corrects `eluded to` to `alluded to` in contexts referring to indirect references.

harper.linters.EnMasse.description: Detects variants like `on mass` or `in mass` and suggests `en masse`.

harper.linters.Everywhere.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `everywhere`.

harper.linters.ExpandTimeShorthands.description: Expands time-related abbreviations (`hr`, `hrs`, `min`, `mins`, `sec`, `secs`, `ms`, `msec`, `msecs`) to their full forms (`hour`, `hours`, `minute`, `minutes`, `second`, `seconds`, `millisecond`, `milliseconds`).

harper.linters.FaceFirst.description: Ensures `face first` is correctly hyphenated as `face-first` when used before `into`.

harper.linters.FastPaste.description: Detects incorrect usage of `fast paste` or `fast-paste` and suggests `fast-paced` as the correct phrase.

harper.linters.FatalOutcome.description: Replaces `fatal outcome` with the more direct term `death` for conciseness.

harper.linters.Forthwith.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `forthwith`.

harper.linters.Furthermore.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `furthermore`.

harper.linters.GoingTo.description: Corrects `gong to` to the intended phrase `going to`.

harper.linters.GoogleNames.description: When referring to Google products and services, make sure to treat them as proper nouns.

harper.linters.HadOf.description: Flags the unnecessary use of `of` after `had` and suggests the correct forms.

harper.linters.Henceforth.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `henceforth`.

harper.linters.Hereby.description: `Here by` in some contexts should be `hereby`

harper.linters.Holidays.description: When referring to holidays, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.HopHope.description: Handles common errors involving `hop` and `hope`. Ensures `hop` is used correctly in phrases like `hop on a bus` while correcting mistaken uses of `hope` in contexts where `hop` is expected.

harper.linters.However.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `however`.

harper.linters.HyphenateNumberDay.description: Ensures a hyphen is used in `X-day` when it is part of a compound adjective, such as `4-day work week`.

harper.linters.IAm.description: Fixes the incorrect spacing in `I a m` to properly form `I am`.

harper.linters.InThe.description: Detects and corrects a spacing error where `in the` is mistakenly written as `int he`. Proper spacing is essential for readability and grammatical correctness in common phrases.

harper.linters.Insofar.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `insofar`.

harper.linters.Instead.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `instead`.

harper.linters.Intact.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `intact`.

harper.linters.Into.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `into`.

harper.linters.IsKnownFor.description: Typo: `known` is the correct past participle.

harper.linters.ItCan.description: Corrects the misspelling `It cam` to the proper phrase `It can`.

harper.linters.Itself.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `itself`.

harper.linters.JetpackNames.description: Ensure proper capitalization of Jetpack-related terms.

harper.linters.Koreas.description: When referring to the nations, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.Laptop.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `laptop`.

harper.linters.LeftRightHand.description: Ensures `left hand` and `right hand` are hyphenated when used as adjectives before a noun, such as in `left-hand side` or `right-hand corner`.

harper.linters.LetsConfusion.description: It's often hard to determine where the subject should go with the word `let`. This rule attempts to find common errors with redundancy and contractions that may lead to confusion for readers.

harper.linters.Likewise.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `likewise`.

harper.linters.LinkingVerbs.description: Linking verbs connect nouns to other ideas. Make sure you do not accidentally link words that aren't nouns.

harper.linters.LongSentences.description: This rule looks for run-on sentences, which can make your work harder to grok.

harper.linters.Malaysia.description: When referring to the states of Malaysia and their capitals, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.Matcher.description: A collection of curated rules. A catch-all that will be removed in the future.

harper.linters.MergeWords.description: Accidentally inserting a space inside a word is common. This rule looks for valid words that are split by whitespace.

harper.linters.MetaNames.description: When referring to Meta products and services, make sure to treat them as proper nouns.

harper.linters.MicrosoftNames.description: When referring to Microsoft products and services, make sure to treat them as proper nouns.

harper.linters.Middleware.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `middleware`.

harper.linters.Misunderstand.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `misunderstand`.

harper.linters.Misunderstood.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `misunderstood`.

harper.linters.Misuse.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `misuse`.

harper.linters.Misused.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `misused`.

harper.linters.Multicore.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `multicore`.

harper.linters.Multimedia.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `multimedia`.

harper.linters.MultipleSequentialPronoun.description: When editing work to change point of view (i.e. first-person or third-person) it is common to add pronouns while neglecting to remove old ones. This rule catches cases where you have multiple disparate pronouns in sequence.

harper.linters.Multithreading.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `multithreading`.

harper.linters.MutePoint.description: Ensures `moot point` is used instead of `mute point`, as `moot` means debatable or irrelevant.

harper.linters.MyHouse.description: Fixes the typo `mu house` to `my house`.

harper.linters.Myself.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `myself`.

harper.linters.NationalCapitals.description: When referring to national capitals, make sure to treat it as a proper noun.

harper.linters.NeedHelp.description: Changes `ned help` to the correct `need help`.

harper.linters.NoOxfordComma.description: The Oxford comma is one of the more controversial rules in common use today. Enabling this lint checks that there is no comma before `and`, `or` or `nor` when listing out more than two ideas.

harper.linters.Nobody.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `nobody`.

harper.linters.Nonetheless.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `nonetheless`.

harper.linters.NotTo.description: Corrects `no to` to `not to`, ensuring proper negation.

harper.linters.Nothing.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `nothing`.

harper.linters.Notwithstanding.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `notwithstanding`.

harper.linters.NumberSuffixCapitalizatio.description: You should never capitalize number suffixes.

harper.linters.OceansAndSeas.description: When referring to the world's oceans and seas, ensure they are treated as proper nouns.

harper.linters.OfCourse.description: Detects the non‚Äêidiomatic phrase `off course` and suggests the correct form `of course`.

harper.linters.OperativeSystem.description: Ensures `operating system` is used correctly instead of `operative system`.

harper.linters.OperativeSystems.description: Ensures `operating systems` is used correctly instead of `operative systems`.

harper.linters.OutOfDate.description: Ensures that the phrase `out of date` is written with a hyphen as `out-of-date` when used as a compound adjective.

harper.linters.Overall.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `overall`.

harper.linters.Overclocking.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `overclocking`.

harper.linters.Overload.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `overload`.

harper.linters.Overnight.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `overnight`.

harper.linters.OxfordComma.description: The Oxford comma is one of the more controversial rules in common use today. Enabling this lint checks that there is a comma before `and`, `or`, or `nor` when listing out more than two ideas.

harper.linters.PiqueInterest.description: Detects incorrect usage of `peak` or `peek` when the intended word is `pique`, as in the phrase `you've peaked my interest`.

harper.linters.PluralConjugate.description: Make sure you use the correct conjugation of the verb "to be" in plural contexts.

harper.linters.PocketCastsNames.description: Ensure proper capitalization of Pocket Casts and Pocket Casts Plus as brand names.

harper.linters.PointIsMoot.description: Typo: `moot` (meaning debatable) is correct rather than `mute`.

harper.linters.PossessiveYour.description: The possessive version of `you` is more common before nouns.

harper.linters.Postpone.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `postpone`.

harper.linters.PronounContraction.description: Choosing when to contract pronouns is a challenging art. This rule looks for faults.

harper.linters.Proofread.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `proofread`.

harper.linters.Regardless.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `regardless`.

harper.linters.RepeatedWords.description: This rule looks for repetitions of words that are not homographs.

harper.linters.RoadMap.description: Detects when `roadmap` is used instead of `road map`, prompting the correct spacing.

harper.linters.SameAs.description: Corrects the incorrect phrase `same then` to the standard `same as`.

harper.linters.SentenceCapitalization.description: The opening word of a sentence should almost always be capitalized.

harper.linters.Somebody.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `somebody`.

harper.linters.Somehow.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `somehow`.

harper.linters.SomewhatSomething.description: When describing a single instance of a noun, use `something` rather than `somewhat`.

harper.linters.Somewhere.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `somewhere`.

harper.linters.SoonerOrLater.description: Fixes the improper phrase `sooner than later` by suggesting standard alternatives.

harper.linters.Spaces.description: Words should be separated by at most one space.

harper.linters.SpellCheck.description: Looks and provides corrections for misspelled words.

harper.linters.SpelledNumbers.description: Most style guides recommend that you spell out numbers less than ten.

harper.linters.StateOfTheArt.description: Detects incorrect usage of `state of art` and suggests `state of the art` as the correct phrase.

harper.linters.SupposedTo.description: Fixes `suppose to` to the correct `supposed to`.

harper.linters.TerminatingConjunctions.description: Subordinating conjunctions are words that create a grammatical space for another idea or clause. As such, they should never appear at the end of a clause.

harper.linters.ThatChallenged.description: Changes `the challenged` to `that challenged` to fix the misspelling.

harper.linters.ThatThis.description: Fixes `the this` to the correct phrase `that this`.

harper.linters.ThatWhich.description: Repeating the word "that" is often redundant. The phrase `that which` is easier to read.

harper.linters.Therefore.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `therefore`.

harper.linters.Thereupon.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `thereupon`.

harper.linters.TumblrNames.description: Ensure proper capitalization of Tumblr-related terms.

harper.linters.TurnItOff.description: Fixes the mistake in the phrase `turn it off`.

harper.linters.UnclosedQuotes.description: Quotation marks should always be closed. Unpaired quotation marks are a hallmark of sloppy work.

harper.linters.Underclock.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `underclock`.

harper.linters.UnitedOrganizations.description: When referring to national or international organizations, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.Upset.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `upset`.

harper.linters.Upward.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `upward`.

harper.linters.UseGenitive.description: Looks for situations where the genitive case of "there" should be used.

harper.linters.WantBe.description: Detects incorrect usage of `want be` and suggests `won't be` or `want to be` based on context.

harper.linters.WasAloud.description: Ensures `was aloud` and `were aloud` are corrected to `was allowed` or `were allowed` when referring to permission.

harper.linters.WaveFunction.description: Identifies the mistake of merging `wave` and `function` into one word. In quantum mechanics, a `wave function` (written as two words) describes the mathematical function that represents the quantum state of a particle or system. Correct usage is crucial for clear and accurate scientific communication.

harper.linters.Whereas.description: The Whereas rule is designed to identify instances where the phrase `where as` is used in text and suggests replacing it with the single word `whereas`.

harper.linters.Whereupon.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `whereupon`.

harper.linters.Widespread.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `widespread`.

harper.linters.WillContain.description: Incorrect verb form: `will` should be followed by the base form `contain`.

harper.linters.WordPressDotcom.description: Ensures correct capitalization of WordPress.com. This rule verifies that the official stylization of WordPress.com is used when referring to the hosting provider.

harper.linters.Worldwide.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `worldwide`.

harper.linters.WrongQuotes.description: The key on the keyboard often used as a quotation mark is actually a double-apostrophe. Use the correct character.
